recommendations.recommendation: A bit underrated.. possibly due to the sometimes crappy animation. However, story is good, characters are funny, and the action is pretty decent. Recommended for any fan of fighting/action shounens.
The father of all modern action animes. Ive never been so drawn in by an action series like this one did. :D

Haha, I remember seeing all 112 eps plus one of the movies [Poltergeist Report, maybe] back in 2006. I was only about 12 at the time, so i can`t say whether this would be good for a mature audience for sure. But, from memory, this was a great series with arc after arc being executed very well. It also had nice closure. Definitely recommended for those that want a popular fighting manga or anime.
One of the great original anime`s of the 1990`s. A must see for all anime fans!

Shounen super-power never got better than this. Yuu Yuu Hakusho succeeds in telling a good story, creating charismatic chararacters, showing nice battles and bringing comic elements without losing the direction of the series.
Best shounen ever!Battles and more battles!
Loved this series! Very old but very good and amazing storyline.
One of the best shounen animes of all time.

This story has such an awesome hook and keeps trucking through the Sensui arc, but gets crippled when things turn to Demon World by power creep where it languishes before coming to a somewhat touching end that leaves you feeling it can continue on. Still a great watch! Also, watch this in English if possible, the ad-lib work for Yusuke done by Justin Cook was quite masterful!

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch7220 [Urameshi Yuusuke], 14 years of age, is about as troublesome and violent as teenagers come. He is constantly ditching school, causing uproar, and getting into numerous fights everyday. One day however, he does the unexpected: sacrificing himself to save a young child. Such an action was never ever expected, especially coming from someone as troublesome as Yuusuke. The afterlife is not prepared for Yuusuke, as they never thought he would make such a sacrifice. Nowhere to go, and dead, Yuusuke becomes a ghost and must earn his way back into existence. Yuusuke is "employed" by http://anidb.net/ch25880 [Koenma], who is in charge while his father and ruler of the afterlife, King Enma, is away. Under Koenma`s command, Yuusuke helps to stop menacing demons that threaten the lives of people everywhere - whether by stealing priceless and invaluable items and destructive weapons, or by wreaking havoc on humans. Throughout Yuusuke`s journey, he is usually joined by his arch-rival, and local bully, http://anidb.net/ch7221 [Kuwabara Kazuma]; he is also joined by two demons named http://anidb.net/ch7224 [Hiei] and http://anidb.net/ch7223 [Kurama], who are ex-convicts of the afterlife that managed to escape from Koenma. This group of unlikely allies goes on to participate and struggle in battles that have outcomes that determine the fate of humanity! Yu Yu Hakusho is created by popular mangaka http://anidb.net/cr874 [Togashi Yoshihiro], who is also responsible for creating the acclaimed and much-loved series known as http://anidb.net/a132 [Hunter X Hunter].

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: bodyguard
tag.description: A bodyguard is a type of security guard or government law enforcement officer or soldier who protects a person or people, usually high-ranking public officials or officers, wealthy people, and celebrities, from danger: generally theft, assault, kidnapping, assassination, harassment, loss of confidential information, threats, or other criminal offences. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: extrasensory perception
tag.description: Extrasensory perception (ESP), involves reception of information not gained through the recognized physical senses but sensed with the mind. The term was coined by Sir Richard Burton, and adopted by Duke University psychologist J. B. Rhine to denote psychic abilities such as telepathy and clairvoyance, and their trans-temporal operation as precognition or retrocognition. ESP is also sometimes casually referred to as a sixth sense, gut instinct or hunch, which are historical English idioms. The term implies acquisition of information by means external to the basic limiting assumptions of science, such as that organisms can only receive information from the past to the present. In Japanese usage the term is often misappropriated to refer to any supernatural, non-magical, super power. Users of such powers are called `esper` in Japanese. The term `esper` is not normally in use outside of Japan but is slowly being introduced due to its usage in anime and manga. In anime/manga the following powers, among others, are described as ESP: - telepathy - precognition - clairvoyance - retrocognition - remote viewing - aura reading - out-of-body experiences (OBE) - psychokinesis

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: contemporary fantasy
tag.description: Contemporary fantasy, also known as modern fantasy or indigenous fantasy, is a sub-genre of fantasy, set in the present day. It is perhaps most popular for its sub-genre, urban fantasy. These terms are used to describe stories set in the putative real world (often referred to as consensus reality) in contemporary times, in which magic and magical creatures exist, either living in the interstices of our world or leaking over from alternate worlds. It thus has much in common with, and sometimes overlaps with secret history; a work of fantasy in which the magic could not remain secret or does not have any known relationship to known history would not fit into this subgenre. Occasionally certain contemporary fantasy novels will make reference to pop culture. Novels in which modern characters travel into alternate worlds, and all the magical action takes place there (except for the portal required to transport them), are not considered contemporary fantasy. Thus, C.S. Lewis`s The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, where all fantasy events take place in the land of Narnia which is reached via a magic wardrobe, would not count as contemporary fantasy; on the other hand, the part of The Magician`s Nephew, where the Empress Jadis gets to London, tries to take over the Earth and clashes with police and a crowd of cockneys, would qualify as such. Contemporary fantasy is also to be distinguished from horror fiction, which also often has contemporary settings. When encountering magical events and creatures, the protagonist of a horror novel is horrified, while the protagonist of a fantasy novel (contemporary or otherwise) is filled with a sense of joy and wonder. Horrifying events may happen, but the fundamental distinction is vital. In his preface to That Hideous Strength, one of the earlier works falling within this sub-genre, C.S. Lewis explained why, when writing a tale about "magicians, devils, pantomime animals and planetary angels", he chose to start it with a detailed depiction of narrow-minded academic politics at a provincial English university and the schemes of crooked real estate developers: "I am following the traditional fairy-tale. We do not always notice its method, because the cottages, castles, woodcutters and petty kings with which a fairy tale opens have become for us as remote as the witches and ogres to which it proceeds. But they were not remote at all to the men who first made and enjoyed the tales". The same is true for many of the later works in the genre, which often begin with a seemingly normal scene of modern daily life to then disclose supernatural and magical beings and events hidden behind the scenes. Source: wiki

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: emotions awaken superpowers
tag.description: During an extreme emotional state — rage, love, hate, angst, sadness, compassion — something inside the character will "click" that will increase greatly his/her power or a new superpower awakes, that surpasses anything achieved by him/her until then.

tag.name: fighting
tag.description: For some reason or other one faction has to take it out on some opponent via fight or battle. Typical examples of this are all the anime with "endless pointless fighting" tag.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: preview before ed
tag.description: Unlike most productions, where the next episode preview rolls *after* the ending with the production credits, this title does the reverse: preview the next episode *first*, then enjoy the ED (or skip it if you prefer, without missing the juicy preview details).

tag.name: fate worse than death
tag.description: If you think death is the worst that can ever happen to someone, you had better think again: at least one character in this show is sure to end up in such a terrible way that many people would likely have preferred death if they had the choice. The fate of such characters is normally not for the faint of heart, and the audience is expected to at least sympathise with the poor character`s fate, and at times even be horrified at the shocking turn of events that led to their demise.

tag.name: defeat means friendship
tag.description: In a series based around an endless series of one-on-one fights, defeating a Worthy Opponent or The Rival will sometimes convert them to the hero`s side, if not always to his cause. Furthermore, no matter how many people the Worthy Opponent has killed, how much grief he has caused, even if he slaughtered helpless children or the hero`s own family, as soon as he shows a bit of remorse or goes out of his way to help the hero even once, he will be welcomed into the hero`s circle of True Companions with open arms. (Source: TVTropes)

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Urameshi Yuusuke
character.description: Urameshi Yuusuke is known to be a stereotypical bad seed; having a spotty attendance record, doing poorly in class, and picking fights with many other students. He also smokes cigarettes and drinks alcohol in the manga. He dies after saving a small child from being struck by a car, which is something the guardians of the afterlife did not predict. Koenma allows Botan to becoming Yuusuke`s guide for the Ordeal that he must undergo in order to be brought back to life, as well as help show him that he is actually a good person. He is then forced to become a Spirit Detective who protects the human race from demons.

character.name: Kuwabara Kazuma
character.description: Kazuma Kuwabara is the second toughest student in Sarayashiki Junior High School and is always trying to usurp Yusuke Urameshi`s position as the toughest. He develops feelings for the ice apparition, Yukina, though it becomes difficult since she remains oblivious of them, mainly from having been raised in a single gendered culture. Kuwabara is fiercely loyal to the the people closest to him, such as his trio of friends, as well as the other members of the Spirit Detectives.

character.name: Kurama
character.description: Kurama (蔵馬 warehouse horse) is a demon thief who, after being wounded by a bounty hunter, possesses and fuses with the unborn son of Shiori Minamino. Growing up for fifteen years as Shuichi Minamino (南野 秀一 south field, excellence first), Kurama has learned to embrace his human lifestyle. Kurama is a polite, soft-spoken boy and a dutiful son. He is regarded as a prodigy at his high school, Meiou Shiritsu Gakuen (盟王私立学園 Oath of Kings Private High School). Calm and analytical, Kurama will go to any lengths to accomplish his goals, even if they endanger his life. He prefers to study the strengths and weaknesses of his opponents before devising a strategy of his own. He has an incredible sense of smell and has picked up many skills over the years, including the ability to read lips[8]. Kurama`s real talent is with plants: He can turn plants into deadly weapons, and has been known to use herbal remedies to treat wounds and other ailments. His favorite weapon is a bara shibenjin (薔薇棘鞭刃 rose thorny whip-blade), commonly called the Rose Whip.

character.name: Hiei
character.description: Hiei (飛影 flying shadow) is a male fire demon born to a race of female ice demons called koorime (氷女 ice maiden). His mother, Hina, is forced to abandon him because koorime prohibit male children. Hiei is taken in by a group of thieves and learns to kill at a very young age. Throughout his traumatic childhood, his one shred of sanity is a necklace made from his mother`s hiruiseki (氷涙石 ice tear stone). He eventually loses the necklace in the heat of battle. In order to find the lost hirui, Hiei acquires the Jagan (邪眼 Evil Eye). He uses the Jagan to seek out the place of his birth and learns that the grief-stricken Hina committed suicide after losing her son. Hiei also learns that he has a twin sister, Yukina, who has disappeared from the village. He now has another goal, to search for Yukina.

character.name: Yukimura Keiko
character.description: Yukimura Keiko (雪村 螢子) is Yusuke`s childhood friend; nowadays, they are near polar opposites, Keiko being a straight-A student and Yusuke being a juvenile delinquent, but the two are both closer than either like to admit. Keiko`s parents run a ramen restaurant named Yukimura Diner (雪村食堂 Yukimura Shokudou). After Yusuke is killed in a car accident, he is permitted another chance to live should someone, who ends up being Keiko, kiss his corpse. Yusuke tries not to involve her with his spirit detective experiences, though multiple interferences from demons prevent this. After being told an almost unbelievable lie by Botan, Keiko learns the truth when she goes with Botan, Yukina, Shizuru and Atsuko to the Dark Tournament, and continues supporting Yusuke in his further adventures. Towards the end of the series, Yusuke proposes to Keiko, telling her that no matter where life takes them, they will always be together in each others` hearts, even after having to wait three years for him to return to her. In the English FUNimation anime her name is spelled Kayko.

character.name: Botan
character.description: Botan is the grim reaper, or guide to the underworld. She is charged with ferrying souls of the deceased to the underworld to face their final judgment. She also acts as http://anidb.net/ch7220 [Yusuke`s] assistant and trainer as he starts out his tenure as underworld detective.

character.name: Urameshi Atsuko
character.description: Urameshi Atsuko is Yusuke`s alcoholic mother, who gave birth to him when she was only fourteen. Atsuko wants nothing more than for her son to turn out better than her, but does not succeed. While Yusuke rarely gets along with her, she truly cares about him, which he only sees when he notices her crying at his wake.

character.name: Genkai
character.description: Teaches Yusuke how to harness his spiritual power.

character.name: Randou
character.description: Yusuke`s major opponent in the battle to become Genkai`s student.

character.name: Genbu
character.description: A rock monster who resides in the Labyrinthine Castle. Kurama fights and defeats him.

character.name: Byakko
character.description: The second of the Four Beasts. Kuwabara insists on fighting Byakko solo, which proves to be a long and dangerous fight.

character.name: Seiryu
character.description: The fourth beast in the Labyrinthine Castle. He kills Byakko, and is subsequently quickly slain by Hiei. He has power over ice and great speed.

character.name: Murugu
character.description: Suzaku`s bird companion. Proves to be useless and rather irritating.

character.name: Karasu
character.description: Karasu is a Quest-class demon. Like Bui, Karasu fought against the Toguro brothers and lost and subsequently became a member of Team Toguro. He is able to use his aura to create bombs undetectable by lower level demons, as well as create bombs within his victims. Karasu displays sadistic tendencies during his fights and delights in torturing and humiliating his opponents. He wears a mask over his mouth which restricts his unstable powers. He is also able to use his entire body as an explosive. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Toguro Otouto
character.description: Younger Toguro is a human turned (absolute strength class, rated as a B-class) demon and the main antagonist during the Dark Tournament arc. His signature is the ability to regulate how much of his maximum power he releases, ranging from 0% to 100%. With each increase comes a burst of demon energy and his muscles thicken and enlarge themselves. At full power, his appearance changes drastically, affecting even his skin color, but requires him to feed on souls to maintain such immense power, which leads him to suck out the souls of the weaker creatures in the surrounding area through special appendages on his upper back. He also has the ability to move fast enough to not be seen. Once a great martial arts master and Genkai`s lover, Toguro is psychologically scarred when a demon named Kairin kills all of the students at his dojo. Toguro and Genkai participate in the Dark Tournament and defeat Kairin in the final round. Toguro decides he does not want to age and lose his power, so as his prize for winning he asks to be turned into a demon. 50 years later he returns to the Dark Tournament, challenging Yusuke, hoping he has finally found a fighter worthy of his full 100% power. He dies in their fight and in the afterlife Koenma offers him a lighter sentence for his misdeeds, however, Toguro refuses and requests the harshest sentence there is: 10,000 years of torture in hell for 10,000 cycles, with your soul ceasing to exist afterward (in the English anime dub it is changed to him requesting "limbo"). In the anime television series, Younger Toguro is voiced by Tesshou Genda in Japanese and Dameon Clarke in English.[2] Togashi considers the Toguro brothers to be his favorite villains in the series because they are "fundamentally unrestrained"

character.name: Mukuro
character.description: Mukuro (軀) is one of the three kings of the Makai realm. Early in her childhood, she is sold into slavery to a humanoid demon named Chikou. Her master is continuously cruel to her and used Mukuro as a sex slave. He raped her every year on her birthday. To control her, he implanted a single memory of himself being kind into her mind, which she remembered each time she thought of killing him. When she turned seven years old, she poured acid on herself, hoping that her master would lose interest in her.

episode.title: 死んだらオドロいた
Surprised to Be Dead
Entre un monde et l`autre
A Morte
A Morte
Un lucru neaşteptat
Shindara Odoroita
episode.summary: Teen hoodlum Yusuke is having a typical day – until he makes the ultimate sacrifice by diving in front of a speeding car to save a little boy’s life! Is it really time for this brash young man’s existence to come to an end? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 霊界のコエンマ! 復活への試練
Koenma Appears
Junior, roi des Enfers
No Mundo Espiritual - Teste da Ressurreição
No Mundo Espiritual - Teste da Ressurreição
Apariţia lui Koenma
Reikai no Koenma! Fukkatsu e no Shiren
episode.summary: After entering the Spirit World, Yusuke meets Koenma, a 700 year-old ruler with the body of a toddler! But there’s no room for laughs, as Koenma gives Yusuke an ordeal to restore his life: hatching a Spirit Beast! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追いつめられた桑原! 男の誓い
Kuwabara: A Promise Between Men
Une amitié à la vie à la mort
Kuwabara, o promisiune între bărbaţi
Oitsumerareta Kuwabara! Otoko no Chikai
episode.summary: With his rival Yusuke gone, Kuwabara is the new kid to beat, which means he’s making plenty of enemies. Yusuke isn’t fond of this classmate, but if he wants to win back his life, he’ll need to give him a ghostly hand. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱き炎! 恋人のきずな
Requirements for Lovers
Preuve d`amour
Dragostea cea mare
Atsuki Honoo! Koibito no Kizuna
episode.summary: Spirit World forgot an important question: does anyone even want Yusuke back? And will Yusuke give up the Spirit Beast, his one chance of reviving, when his friends suddenly find themselves in danger? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三匹の妖怪! 飛影・蔵馬・剛鬼
Three Monsters
Les trois démons
Trei monştri
Sambiki no Youkai! Hiei, Kurama, Gouki
episode.summary: Three demon thieves have muscled their way into King Yama’s vault, stealing the three Artifacts of Darkness. Yusuke must recover the artifacts and bring the thieves to justice before they unleash their powers upon the Earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蔵馬の秘密?! 母と子のきずな
Gouki and Kurama
Le secret de Kurama
Gouki si Kurama
Kurama no Himitsu?! Haha to Ko no Kizuna
episode.summary: Yusuke’s closing in on Gouki, a monster that’s capturing the souls of children, when the second thief suddenly appears. His name is Kurama, and he asks Yusuke for a surprising favor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幽助苦戦! 傷だらけの反撃!!
Hard Fights for Yusuke
Une bataille éprouvante
O luptă grea pentru Yusuke. Un contraatac sângeros
Yuusuke Kusen! Kizu Darake no Hangeki
episode.summary: In his first match of the tournament, Yusuke can’t see a thing in the pitch-black arena, but Kibano is able to follow Urameshi’s every move. If the detective survives Kibano, his next fight – against a ninja – will start immediately! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 螢子あやうし! 邪眼師・飛影

Le Monstre aux Cent Yeux
Hiei cel cu trei ochi
Keiko Ayaushi! Jaganshi Hiei
episode.summary: The ruthless demon Hiei kidnaps Yusuke’s girlfriend, Kayko. Urameshi must retrieve the antidote inside Hiei’s Shadow Sword before Kayko becomes a brainless slave! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 乱童あらわる! 桑原無念の敗北
Rando Rises, Kuwabara Falls
La défaite de Kuwabara
Apariţia lui Rando. Marea înfrângere a lui Kuwabara
Rando Arawaru! Kuwabara Munen no Haiboku
episode.summary: Yusuke, Kuwabara, and Shorin are the only fighters still standing in the Genkai Tournament. Yet Rando has not been found. Could this mean that Shorin is actually Rando? Or is the demon lurking somewhere in the shadows? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻海の継承者トーナメント開始
The Search Begins
La chasse est ouverte !
Căutarea
Genkai no Keishousha Tournament Kaishi
episode.summary: Aging psychic Genkai is ready to find a student worthy of her Spirit Wave technique, but demonic Rando plans to steal the technique and use it for mass destruction! Yusuke must go undercover and infiltrate Genkai’s compound! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幽助VS乱童 乱れとぶ妖術!!
Yusuke vs. Rando: 99 Attacks
Yusuke contre Rando
Yusuke contra Rando. Magie după magie
Yuusuke vs Rando: Midare Tobu Youjutsu
episode.summary: As Yusuke’s energy dwindles, the evil Rando reveals his true and monstrous form. Can the injured Yusuke beat the human-hunting demon’s 99 deadly techniques and close the case? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幽助復活! 新たなる使命
Yusuke`s Back
Retour à la vie
Yusuke s-a întors!
Yuusuke Fukkatsu! Aratanaru Shimei
episode.summary: Back in the flesh, Yusuke finds he can see supernatural creatures hiding in the living world and quickly hunts down a demon criminal. With this move, he learns his adventure is only beginning. Yusuke is now a Spirit Detective! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迷宮城の四聖獣! 霊界への挑戦
The Beasts of Maze Castle
Le défi du Château Maléfique
Cele patru bestii sacre din Castelul Labirint
Meikyuu Shiro no Yon Seijuu! Reikai e no Chousen
episode.summary: Yusuke must take action to stop sinister forces from flooding the earth with demons. With Kuwabara at his side, Urameshi prepares to face four deadly creatures known as the Saint Beasts. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暗闇の死闘! 桑原・霊気の剣
Kuwabara`s Spirit Sword
Duel dans les ténèbres
Spada spirituală a lui Kuwabara
Kurayami no Shitou! Kuwabara: Reiki no Ken
episode.summary: The candidates for Genkai’s apprenticeship have been narrowed to eight. Among them: Yusuke, Kuwabara, and the disguised demon Rando! Genkai announces the final test will be a tournament – fought in total darkness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美しきバラの舞! 華麗なる蔵馬
Genbu, the Stone Beast
Kurama et le combat de la rose
Cele patru bestii sacre. O provocare pentru lumea spirituală
Utsukushi Kibara no Mai! Karei Naru Kurama
episode.summary: Kurama and Hiei join Yusuke and Kuwabara in battle against the Saint Beasts. After the awkward allies struggle through the Gate of Betrayal, they face the first Beast: a giant made of solid stone! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暗黒武術会への招待者
Toguro Returns

Vrem să fim puternici! Intoarcerea fraţilor Toguro
Ankoku Bujutsukai e no Shoutaisha
episode.summary: Spirit World makes a chilling discovery: the Toguro Brothers faked defeat! Now Yusuke must enter a competition run by the criminal world – or everyone he knows will be hunted down and destroyed! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死の船出! 地獄の島へ
The Dark Tournament Begins
Le tournoi des arts martiaux de l`ombre
Începe competiţia
Shi no Funade! Jigoku no Shime e

episode.title: 恐ろしき強敵! 三鬼衆
The Deadly Triad
Les Sanki-Shu
Duşmanul de temut, Sankishuu
Osoroshiki Kyouteki! Sankishuu
episode.summary: Struggling their way to the front gates of Tarukane’s stronghold, Yusuke, Kuwabara, and Botan now face a much greater challenge: three notorious demon fighters known throughout Spirit World as the Triad! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃えろ桑原! 愛の底力
Kuwabara`s Fight of Love
Le pouvoir de l`amour
Lupta, Kuwabara! Puterea dragostei
Moero Kuwabara! Ai no Sokojikara
episode.summary: One battle stands in the way of Yukina’s rescue: Yusuke and Kuwabara versus the Toguro Brothers! Elsewhere, Kurama races to stop Hiei, who is entering Tarukane’s stronghold with his own violent agenda! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の四聖獣・朱雀!
Suzaku, Leader of the Beasts
Suzaku, le dernier des Shiseiju !
Suzaku, ultima bestie
Saigo no Yon Seijuu: Suzaku!
episode.summary: Humans controlled by the Makai Insects have been sent to hunt down Kayko! Yusuke’s only chance to save her is to destroy the Makai Whistle, which rests in the hand of Suzaku, the final Saint Beast! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伸びよ霊剣! 桑原・男の勝負
Byakko, the White Tiger
Le combat de Kuwabara et son Épée Astrale
Vino, sabie spirituală! Lupta lui Kuwabara!
Nobi yo Reiken! Kuwabara: Otoko no Shoubu
episode.summary: One of Yusuke’s teammates has been badly injured, and Kuwabara insists on fighting the next enemy all by himself. Before the bickering group can disagree, a roar slices through the castle – the second Saint Beast is set to attack! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 白虎・地獄の雄叫び
Byakko`s Lair
Byakko, le dévoreur d`énergie
Strigătul de război al tigrului alb
Byakko Jigoku no Osakebi
episode.summary: Byakko is seemingly defeated – until Yusuke’s team enters the Beast’s secret lair! Does Kuwabara have what it takes to crush Byakko once and for all? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奥義激突! 七人の朱雀
Seven Ways to Die
Le combat maléfique
Tehnici secrete, dublurile lui Suzaku
Ougi Gekitotsu! Nananin no Sujaku
episode.summary: As three battles rage simultaneously, Suzaku reveals his most incredible technique of all: multiplying himself for a total of seven deadly Suzakus! Can Yusuke overcome these odds and save the girl he cares about most? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 飛影出戦! 切り裂く剣
Seiryu, the Blue Dragon
Le combat de Hieï
Hiei luptă! Sabia lui îi taie pe duşmani in bucăţi!
Hiei de Ikusa! Kirisaku Ken
episode.summary: Two of the four Saint Beasts are dead – or so Yusuke and his team believe! But in the chamber of Seiryu, a Beast who can trap his enemies in ice, an unexpected guest arrives. How can two Beasts in one room be stopped? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幽助・命を賭けた反撃
Yusuke`s Sacrifice
Yusuke contre-attaque
Yusuke işi riscă viaţa
Yuusuke: Inochi o Kaketa Hangeki
episode.summary: In Maze Castle’s highest tower, Suzaku forces the exhausted Yusuke to his knees. Clearly, there is only one way for the war against the Saint Beasts to end. Yusuke must surrender his life! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悲しみの美少女・雪菜
Lamenting Beauty
Yukina, la princesse triste
Frumuseţea tristă, Yukina
Kanashimi no Bishoujo: Yukina
episode.summary: The Ice Apparition Yukina, whose tears transform into jewels, has been abducted by Tarukane. Yusuke, Kuwabara, and Botan quickly plot a rescue mission – but why is Hiei not allowed to know? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 小さな強敵! 鈴駒の秘技
First Fight
La première rencontre
Începe prima luptă
Chiisana Kyouteki! Suzu Koma no Higi
episode.summary: Team Urameshi is slated for the first fight against the Rokuyukai Team, but with Yusuke locked in deep slumber, the role of team captain falls on Kuwabara. With Spirit Sword drawn, he volunteers for the first match. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇の使者! 戸愚呂兄弟
The Toguro Brothers Gang
Les messagers des Ténèbres
Mesagerul fraţilor Toguro
Yami no Shisha! Toguro Kyoudai
episode.summary: Yusuke’s Spirit Detective team continues toward Tarukane’s mountain stronghold, facing a small army of grotesque demon guards. And Kuwabara fights with extra passion after declaring he’s in love with Yukina! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇アイテム・死出の羽衣

Le point de non retour
Atuul lui Shishiwakaramu, Promontoriul fărş întoarcere!
Yami Item: Shide no Hagoromo
episode.summary: Kuwabara is set to square off against Shishi Wakamaru, but his source of power, Yukina, is nowhere to be found. Shishi’s secret weapon sends Kuwabara through a dimensional portal. What will he find on the other side? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 野望を粉砕! 光りの洗礼
Ambition Destroyed: A Trial of Light
L`épreuve de la lumière
O ambiţie distrusă
Yabou o Funsai! Hikari no Senrei
episode.summary: The doctor’s human experiments are clearly fighting against their will! As Yusuke prepares to put them out of their misery, the Masked Fighter intervenes and suggests a peculiar plan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 爆烈! 目覚めた妖狐
The Beast Within
Le réveil de Yoko
Monstrul a fost trezit
Bakuretsu! Mezameta Youko
episode.summary: Kurama finds himself facing the dangerous Karasu. Kurama, believing that it’s his only chance to defeat his eerie opponent, transforms himself into the powerful and equally ruthless Yoko Kurama. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蔵馬無惨! 死の化粧
Kurama`s Stand
Le masque
Tragedia lui Kurama! Machiajul morţii
Kurama Muzan! Shi no Keshou
episode.summary: The fighters of Team Masho are revealed to be the Shinobi of Spirit World, an ancient ninja sect. Now, thanks to Gama’s curse, Kurama must face the Ice Master Touya without the use of his body or his energy! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻海散る! 50年目の決着
The Death of Genkai
Mortelles retrouvailles
Genkai moare. Un final după 50 de ani

episode.summary: The history of Genkai and Toguro is finally revealed! Genkai is at the mercy of her former friend, and as Toguro prepares to deliver the final blow, Yusuke races toward the scene of the battle. What will he find when he arrives? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 究極奥義! ほえろ黒龍波
Wielder of the Dragon
L`ultime technique
Atacul suprem, Kokuryu-Ha!
Kyuukyoku Ougi! Hoero Kuroryuu Ha
episode.summary: Hiei unleashes his most powerful attack, the Dragon of the Darkness Flame, but Bui is able to turn the Dragon against his master. Will Hiei be swallowed and destroyed by his own power? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 残された力! 幻海の死闘
Genkai`s Strength
La force illimitée de Genkai
Genkai. Luptă cu ultimul strop de putere!
Nokosareta Chikara! Maboroshi Umi no Shitou
episode.summary: Unmasked and without the power of her Spirit Wave, Genkai must rely on her wits to survive in the ring. But is the wise woman’s intellect enough to combat the horror of Shishi Wakamaru’s Chorus of a Thousand Skulls? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 血の花を咲かす蔵馬!
Flowers of Blood
Du sang sur le ring
Flori pe ringul de luptă
Chi no Hana o Sakasu Kurama!
episode.summary: In the second match, Kurama’s opponent holds a secret that threatens the person he holds most dear! Can Roto be defeated before the unthinkable happens? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔闘家・鈴木の挑戦!
Suzuk`s Challenge
Le défi de Suzuki
Provocarea luptatorului Suzuka
Matouya: Suzuki no Chousen!
episode.summary: Onji has his work cut out for him when he takes on Kuwabara and Genkai. However, the old man is not who he appears to be, and what lies beneath the surface could spell a major upset for Team Urameshi! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! ベスト8出そろう
A Day in Waiting
Le défi des 8 finalistes
Al optulea învingător
Gekitotsu! Best 8 Desorou
episode.summary: When he’s ambushed by a loose-cannon competitor, Yusuke learns that even quiet moments on Hanging-Neck Island are dangerous. Meanwhile, Hiei faces the consequences of his deadly dragon attack. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風使い陣! 嵐の空中戦
Jin, the Wind Master
Jin, le maître du vent
Jin, stăpânul vântului. O încăierare pe cinste
Kazetsukai Jin! Arashi no Kuuchuusen
episode.summary: Jin, Team Masho’s fourth member, is a fast-talking Master of Wind who hates authority. He identifies with Yusuke more than any guy ever has, but with everything at stake, they must lay their friendship aside. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 波瀾の決勝戦開始!
The Beginning of the End
En route pour la finale
Un final memorabil
Haran no Kesshousenkaishi!
episode.summary: Each team must take on an extra member in order to compete in the tournament finals. Who are the two new fighters and what could they possibly bring to their new teams? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻海からの最大の試練
Yusuke`s Final Test
L`ultime épreuve de Genkai
Încercarea suprema
Maboroshi Umi kara no Saidai no Shiren
episode.summary: As his team prepares for the semi-finals, Yusuke is taken to a cave in the woods where Genkai will give him his final test. Is Yusuke’s soul pure enough to handle the intense mental and physical trial? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 粉砕! 幽助怒りの鉄拳
Crushing Revenge
La colère de Yusuke
Pumnul nimicitor al lui Yusuke
Funsai! Yuusuke Ikari no Tekken
episode.summary: Yusuke tries to step in for the unconscious Kurama, but the crooked tournament committee announces that Kurama must remain. Can Yusuke overcome the rule-makers, save Kurama, and fight the last three opponents himself? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決死の蔵馬! 最後の手段
Yoko`s Magic
Le grand sacrifice
Ultima armă a lui Kurama
Kesshi no Kuraba! Saigo no Shudan
episode.summary: Karasu is set to take the victory! Taking his own life into his hands, Kurama prepares to sacrifice his life energy to defeat the demon. But with no life energy remaining, Kurama may stay down forever. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 未完の奥義・炎殺黒龍波
Dragon of the Darkness Flame
le feu du dragon noir
O tehnică secretă neperfectată
Mikan no Ougi: Honooya Kuroryuuha
episode.summary: Hiei takes on Rokuyukai’s leader, Zeru, whose explosive fire attacks ravage the stadium. Hiei must resort to an unbelievable technique, one that could take his life as well: he must summon the power of a dragon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 脅威! 鎧を外した武威
Beneath Bui`s Armor
Le mystère de l`armure
E în pericol! Bui ii scoate armura!
Kyoui! Yoroi o Hazushita Take Takeshi
episode.summary: After a disappointing verdict is handed down in the Kurama versus Karasu match, Hiei seeks to recover from the setback in the ring with Bui. Will the power lurking beneath Bui’s armor be too much for him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦慄! 黒桃太郎の変身
Many Faces, Many Forms
La transformation de Momotaro
Teribila transformare a lui Kurumomotaro
Senritsu! Kuro Momotarou no Henshin
episode.summary: Hiei’s attacks have proven useless against Kuro Momotaro, and as his raging opponent prepares to make a third and final transformation, Hiei prepares to join his shattered sword on the arena floor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怒り爆発! 桑原の反撃
Sakyo`s Proposal
Le grand pari de Sakyô
Propunerea lui Sakyo
Ikari Bakuhatsu! Kuwabara no Hangeki
episode.summary: Before Yusuke’s grudge match with the younger Toguro can begin, intrigue at Team Toguro culminates in a shocking proposal from Sakyo – and an even more shocking response from Koenma! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇の忍・魔性使いチーム
Master of Disguise
L`équipe de Masho, les ninjas des Ténèbres
Războinicul nopţii. Echipa Masho
Yami no Nin: Mahoutsukai Team

episode.title: 覆面の正体?! 美しき戦士

episode.title: 決死の桑原! 愛の突撃

Pe viaţă şi pe moarte

Au-delà de la tristesse

episode.title: 勝率0.05%の死闘!
Percentage of Victory

Marea bătălie

Legendaru bandit, Yu-Ku Kurama

Frumosul chip al luptătorului mascat

Un adversar foarte puternic. Umbra lui Toguro

Toguro monte en puissance !
Toguro. Lupta 100%

Noul prolog. Începutul următoarei lupte

Sortie, îngerul întunericului!
